intro: Jennyella wallisii, commonly known as the Wallis's Jennyella, is a rare and small shrub native to Western Australia. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces delicate, pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often found in open woodlands and is a member of the Myrtaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
